overview:
Mr. Jud Gostin has served as Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer since mid-1985 when he founded Sensis Corporation. In this role, he develops the company’s goals, vision and operating philosophy. Through his leadership and direction, Sensis has grown into a market leader of sensors and information technology for the world’s militaries, civil aviation authorities, airports, and airlines, with technology deployed in more than 25 countries across six continents.

Before founding Sensis, Mr. Gostin was a Program General Manager within General Electric’s Radar Systems Department, responsible for a major segment of that department’s business. Through much of his General Electric career, he led the development of advanced air defense systems. Mr. Gostin has been awarded two patents and, in 1978, was selected from a population of about 5,000 engineers to receive the General Electric Centennial Award as the Electronic System Division’s outstanding contributor. Mr. Gostin holds a BA and MSEE from Dartmouth College.
